de.hsbremen.tc.tnc.message.util

Interface ByteBuffer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultByteBuffer, StreamedReadOnlyByteBuffer, StreamedWriteOnlyByteBuffer

    public interface ByteBuffer
    Generic byte buffer, that can be used to write and read bytes from. It also provides several helper functions to read or write different Java primitives from/to the buffer. The buffer has two pointers to indicate the read and write position. Is is not possible to read more bytes than where written to the buffer before. The buffer can throw a underflow or overflow exception. Underflow is thrown if the bytes read exceed the bytes written. Overflow is thrown if the bytes written exceed the buffer capacity.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long bytesRead()
      Returns the bytes already read from the buffer.
      long bytesWritten()
      Returns the bytes currently written to the buffer.
      long capacity()
      Returns the maximum capacity of the buffer, that can be written and read afterwards.
      void clear()
      Clears the buffer.
      boolean isReadable()
      Returns true if the buffer supports reading and false if the buffer is write only (e.g. if the buffer is backed by an input stream it is read only).
      boolean isRevertable()
      Returns true if the buffer supports a revert of the write and read position pointers.
      boolean isWriteable()
      Returns true if the buffer supports writing and false if the buffer is read only (e.g. if the buffer is backed by an output stream it is write only).

      Returns the content of length from the buffer as byte array.

      Returns the content of length from the buffer as byte buffer.

      • readShort

        short readShort(byte length)
        Returns one short from the buffer. The short can be build with 1 or 2 bytes depending on the given length. Maximum length is 2. Useful to read an unsigned byte.
        Parameters:
        length - the content length to read
        Returns:
        the resulting short

      • readInt

        int readInt()
        Returns one int from the buffer.
        Returns:
        the resulting short

      • readInt

        int readInt(byte length)
        Returns one int from the buffer. The int can be build with 1 to 4 bytes depending on the given length. Maximum length is 4. Useful to read an unsigned short.
        Parameters:
        length - the content length to read
        Returns:
        the resulting int

      • readLong

        long readLong()
        Returns one long from the buffer.
        Returns:
        the resulting short

      • readLong

        long readLong(byte length)
        Returns one long from the buffer. The long can be build with 1 to b bytes depending on the given length. Maximum length is 8. Useful to read an unsigned int.
        Parameters:
        length - the content length to read
        Returns:
        the resulting long

      • revertWrite

        long revertWrite(long length)
        Resets the write pointer about the given length of bytes. The new position is bytes written minus length. If the read pointer is larger than the new position, the pointer is set too, that write pointer == read pointer. If the write pointer is smaller than the given length, both pointers are set to zero. Revert write discards all bytes, that are within the reverted length.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to step back
        Returns:
        the new position of the write pointer

      • revertRead

        long revertRead(long length)
        Resets the read pointer about the given length of bytes. The new position is bytes read minus length. If the read pointer is smaller than the given length, the pointer is set to zero. No bytes will be discarded by this operation.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to step back
        Returns:
        the new position of the write pointer

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the buffer. The buffer will be empty after this operation an all pointers will be zero.

      • bytesWritten

        long bytesWritten()
        Returns the bytes currently written to the buffer. If the buffer capacity is larger than MAX_LONG and the number of bytes written is larger than MAX_LONG or the buffer is not writable -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the written bytes count

      • bytesRead

        long bytesRead()
        Returns the bytes already read from the buffer. If the buffer capacity is larger than MAX_LONG and the number of bytes written is larger than MAX_LONG or the buffer is not readable -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the read bytes count

      • isReadable

        boolean isReadable()
        Returns true if the buffer supports reading and false if the buffer is write only (e.g. if the buffer is backed by an input stream it is read only).
        Returns:
        true if buffer supports reading

      • isWriteable

        boolean isWriteable()
        Returns true if the buffer supports writing and false if the buffer is read only (e.g. if the buffer is backed by an output stream it is write only).
        Returns:
        true if buffer supports writing

      • isRevertable

        boolean isRevertable()
        Returns true if the buffer supports a revert of the write and read position pointers.
        Returns:
        true if buffer supports revert

      • capacity

        long capacity()
        Returns the maximum capacity of the buffer, that can be written and read afterwards. If the capacity is not known -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the maximum buffer capacity
